title: Textile, ca. 1795
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by block on plain weave. Two blocks were used; one for red, one for black. The black block had an irregular outline within the picotage area.
inscribed: Stamp at one end: " J.P.Meillier & Cie de Beautiran pres Bourdeaux" in script within lozenge that also contains "D1325" and "NOD84". Also; "Comm. No. 3" and "E.LM within boxes.
provenance: Formenrly owned by Elinor Merrell where it was No. 21 on her list of chefs de piece
dimensions:
Warp: 187 cm (73 3/4 in). Weft: 96 cm (37 3/4 in). Left selvedge present.
Pattern: Height: 25.5 cm (10 in.). Width: 19 cm (7 1/2 in.). Measurements are the same for both the repeat and the printing blocks.
description: Roses within a grid of vine leaves in red and black on a black patterned picotage background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ca. 1795.
ca. 1795. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by block on plain weave. Two blocks were used; one for red, one for black. The black block had an irregular outline within the picotage area.. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-18.
